did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Johan Kugelberg hip hop collection, circa 1975-1985, 2008.
did.physdesc: Audio Recordings, Memorabilia, Photographs, Printed Materials
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: The collection documents the origins of hip-hop as music, culture and community in the Bronx, NY, and its influence on the history of music, art, performance, and activism in America during the final third of the 20th century and beyond.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Contains nearly 1,000 recordings (primarily LP records), textile art, books and magazines, and more than 500 original party and club flyers designed by Buddy Esquire and others. The collection documents the origins of hip-hop as music, culture and community in the Bronx, NY, and its influence on the history of music, art, performance, and activism in America during the final third of the 20th century and beyond.
Also, t-shirts, tote bag, and other memorabilia documenting the 2008 Hip Hop Conference and Celebration at Cornell; and a poster for Spike Lee's motion picture "Do the Right Thing" (1989).
74 candid hip hop photos depicting various music events, record signings and performances - includes Raandu Avion, Brandy, Missy Elliott, Mary J. Blige, DMX and Wyclef Jean (2001).

controlaccess.head: Places:
controlaccess.geogname: Bronx (New York, N.Y.) -- Social conditions -- 20th century.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: Sound recordings on vinyl may be requested and viewed, but not played.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Johan Kugelberg hip hop collection, #8021. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: Books, LPs, and poster associated with the collection are cataloged individually.
This collection was previously titled Cornell University Library hip hop collection
Joe Conzo Jr. photographs and related material previously in boxes 25-31 have been moved to the Joe Conzo, Jr. photographs and ephemera collection, #8091
Spelling of artist names is, in most cases, as it appears on the album, this leads to some discrepancies.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST

p.ref: Box 18 - LPs - Duplicates of some items from Box 1-17
Box 19 - 45s and 7" records - SR 852-922, includes duplicates
Boxes 46-47 - CDs - CD 1470-1510 - Prints created by Cornell Library’s digital reproduction lab in 2014 for Joe Conzo’s exhibition at the Rock and Roll Hall of fame
